block.p: Kimberly Ann Steel and John J. Hagenbuch were married last evening by the Rev. Linda Demorest, a Presbyterian minister, at an outdoor ceremony in Sun Valley, Idaho.
The bride, 38, is a managing director and an investment manager at Watch Hill Investment Partners, a hedge fund in Larchmont, N.Y. She graduated summa cum laude from Dartmouth College.
Kimberly Ann Steel and John J. Hagenbuch were married last evening by the Rev. Linda Demorest, a Presbyterian minister, at an outdoor ceremony in Sun Valley, Idaho.
The bride, 38, is a managing director and an investment manager at Watch Hill Investment Partners, a hedge fund in Larchmont, N.Y. She graduated summa cum laude from Dartmouth College.
She is the daughter of Sue Steel and Dr. John Steel of La Jolla, Calif. The bride's father, a retired urologist, was the chief of staff at Scripps Memorial Hospital in La Jolla.

The bridegroom, 49, is the chairman of Merlone-Hagenbuch, an investment company in San Francisco. He graduated magna cum laude from Princeton University and received an M.B.A. degree from Stanford University.

He is the son of Mrs. David Hagenbuch of San Francisco and the late Mr. Hagenbuch. His father was the chief executive of the Hagen Publishing Corporation, a magazine publishing and advertising research company that was in Upper Montclair, N.J.
The bride's previous marriage ended in divorce, as did the bridegroom's two previous marriages.
